column4: i am having difficulties installing the nvidia driver for my 8400M GS, INCLUDING: "The distribution-provided pre-install script failed!", "THE CC version check failed: the compiler used to compile the kernel gcc 4.2 does not exactly match the current compiler (gcc 4.4). The linux 2.6 kernel module loader rejects kernel modules built with a version of GCC that does not exactly match that of the compiler used to build the running kernel (ignorab

le, and so is the first one)" , "Unable to find the kernel source tree for the currently running kernel (yet they are installed.), and then the installtion fails, FOR some reason i am not able to get a video card driver running on this kernel without it rejecting it and just bringing me to a command line without booting my gui.
so what do i install from here?
open a terminal and type the following comand
$ sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install nvidia-current nvidia-current-modaliases nvidia-settings
crap this will take awhile, slow repo server i guess
but in advance what must i do after
just reboot your computer, or restart the X session
the think you told me didn't fix my problem unfourtunetely lol
now i can boot onto my system but i still can't change my resoultion and my monitor isnt detected
haha np, i don't know what i screwed up though, because they were working before
